name: get_stock_time_series_intraday
description: This API returns current and 20+ years of historical intraday OHLCV time series of the equity specified.

symbol.description: The name of the equity of your choice. For example: symbol=IBM .

interval.description: Time interval between two consecutive data points in the time series. The following values are supported: 1min, 5min, 15min, 30min, 60min.

fulldata.description: By default, fulldata=False. Strings compact and full are accepted with the following specifications: 'False' returns only the latest 100 data points in the intraday time series; 'True' returns trailing 30 days of the most recent intraday data if the month parameter (see above) is not specified, or the full intraday data for a specific month in history if the month parameter is specified. 'False' is recommended if you would like to reduce the data size of each API call.

apikey.description: API key used to access this information.

name: get_stock_time_series_daily
description: This API returns raw (as-traded) daily time series (date, daily open, daily high, daily low, daily close, daily volume) of the global equity specified.

symbol.description: The name of the equity of your choice. For example: symbol=IBM .

fulldata.description: By default, fulldata=False. Strings compact and full are accepted with the following specifications: 'False' returns only the latest 100 data points in the intraday time series; 'True' returns trailing 30 days of the most recent intraday data if the month parameter (see above) is not specified, or the full intraday data for a specific month in history if the month parameter is specified. 'False' is recommended if you would like to reduce the data size of each API call.

apikey.description: API key used to access this information.

name: get_stock_time_series_weekly
description: This API returns weekly time series (last trading day of each week, weekly open, weekly high, weekly low, weekly close, weekly volume) of the global equity specified.

symbol.description: The name of the equity of your choice. For example: symbol=IBM.

apikey.description: API key used to access this information.

name: get_stock_time_series_monthly
description: This API returns monthly time series (last trading day of each month, monthly open, monthly high, monthly low, monthly close, monthly volume) of the global equity specified.

symbol.description: The name of the equity of your choice. For example: symbol=IBM.

apikey.description: API key used to access this information.

name: get_stock_quote_endpoint
description: A lightweight alternative to the time series APIs, this service returns the latest price and volume information for a ticker of your choice.

symbol.description: The name of the equity of your choice. For example: symbol=IBM.

apikey.description: API key used to access this information.

name: get_stock_symbol_search_endpoint
description: The Search Endpoint returns the best-matching symbols and market information based on keywords of your choice.

keywords.description: The name of the equity of your choice. For example: symbol=IBM .

apikey.description: API key used to access this information.

name: get_global_market_open_and_close_status
description: This endpoint returns the current market status (open vs. closed) of major trading venues for equities, forex, and cryptocurrencies around the world.

apikey.description: API key used to access this information.

name: ask_to_user
description: You can ask user for guidance when you think you need more information to handle the task, but you should use this tool as less as you can.

question.description: The question you want to ask to user.

name: finish
description: Finish the task and give your answer.
